issues.title: Break lines at 80 characters
issues.author: cjpatton
issues.body: This make it easier to edit with more text editors (vim in particular) and to read PRs.

issues.title: ZZZZ Tag does not match Ascii representation
issues.author: cjpatton
issues.body:
https://github.com/wbl/roughtime-draft/blob/695381624a2478973d7f090dc60725746a4433d8/draft-ietf-ntp-roughtime.md?plain=1#L537

"ZZZZ" is 0x5a5a5a5a in hex, not 0x7a7a7a7a. This is "zzzz".

The intention is probably "ZZZZ", so the table should be updated to 0x5a5a5a5a.

pulls.title: Add support for key multiplexing
pulls.author: cjpatton
pulls.body:
Resolves https://github.com/aanchal4/draft-roughtime/issues/46.

Add multi-tenancy as an operational consideration. The idea is that if multiple servers share the same IP or port space, then the client needs a way to indicate which server it expects to respond to a request.

To resolve this, define a new request tag, SRV, that indicates the DNS name associated with long-term public key the client expects to verify the response with.

comments.body:
Reviewer note: I'm not super confident about this text. It seems like we need to say something about the extra fingerprinting risk, but I'm not sure what to say.

I guess the fingerprinting risk is similar to SNI for TLS, although it's important to emphasize that we don't lose privacy in the same way.
I'm not sure we want a 1:1 mapping of key to DNS name. Wasn't the idea here to have multiple keys on the same DNS name? Also typo in server

Fixed the typo.

From CF's perspective, the goal is be able to support multiple long-term keys on the same IP and port. It's fine if the mapping from long-term public keys to DNS names is 1:1.

Also, matches your suggestion here: https://mailarchive.ietf.org/arch/msg/ntp/K1InWKz-VKdL20KgSqj6AV0p4cs/

pulls.title: Editorial changes to draft
pulls.author: dansarie
pulls.body:
This fixes a number of minor issues with the draft, including many mentioned in aanchal4/draft-roughtime#45. None of them should be controversial.

* Update author name and organzation.
* Fix misspellings and missing commas.
* Many sections were mushed together into a single paragraph when the draft was converted to Markdown. They are now split up into separate paragraphs again.
* Fix links to sections and figures.
* Update description of radius in protocol overview to be consistent with new radius format.
* Proper variable index subscript in "The Guarantee".
* Replace PAD example with ZZZZ example.
* Some clarifications in "Root Value Validity Check Algorithm"
* Fix paragraphs in "IANA Considerations" that were cut off in the pdf version.
* Move "Privacy Considerations" to come after "Security Considerations".
* Reference RFCs for JSON and base64.

comments.body:
As per https://github.com/wbl/roughtime-draft/issues/4
```suggestion
the tag 0x434e4f4e and "ZZZZ" would correspond to 0x5a5a5a5a. Note
```
